intro: Piqueria galioides, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with spiny stems and dark green, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Piqueria galioides is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
